title: Fallon on 2020 election's non-breaking breaking news
text:
CLOSE The comics take a look at the latest in the presidential race in Best of Late Night. Eileen Rivers, USA TODAY Opinion

The comics take a look at the latest in the presidential race in Best of Late Night.

Another 2020 Democratic presidential candidate bites the dust.

Rep. Tim Ryan, of Ohio, announced dropped out of the race this week. What were the highlights of Ryan's short campaign? James Corden summarizes them for us.

And with such little support, did Ryan's announcement really qualify as front-page news? Late-night comic Jimmy Fallon tells us what's breaking and what's not in 2020 campaign news.

Indiana Mayor Pete Buttigieg takes on the pot industry and Sen. Amy Klobuchar takes on President Donald Trump. Seth Meyers reveals Trump's not-so-stunning comeback.

Jimmy Fallon (Photo: NBC, James White/NBC)

After you watch all of our favorite jokes from last night's late-night lineup on 2020 election news, vote for yours in the poll below.

Follow Eileen Rivers on Twitter @msdc14.
